Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Reece's 'SafeR' Management System manages and controls the processes that make up our SafeR program. A risk management approach underpins the program.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Lead and lag indicators are essential components of a health and safety management system, providing organizations with valuable insights into their performance and helping them proactively manage risks. Tracking lead and lag indicators allows organizations to identify potential issues early and take corrective actions.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: An internal safety target refers to an organization's specific, measurable goal or objective to improve or maintain safety performance within its operations. These targets are established internally, often as part of a broader safety management system, to guide the organization in achieving its safety-related objectives.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Wide-ranging training in health and safety is crucial for ensuring a safe and healthy work environment. Such training programs should cover a variety of topics to address different aspects of workplace safety, emergency preparedness, and risk management.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Network safety rhythms establish a systematic and structured approach to safety within a network or organization, particularly in health and safety. By incorporating these rhythms into the organizational culture, Reece Limited creates a proactive and systematic approach to health and safety.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Team awareness in Reece Limited is critical to creating a safe and secure work environment. When team members know potential hazards, safety protocols, and their roles in maintaining a safe workplace, it significantly reduces the risk of accidents and injuries.

column6: Occupational health services
column13: During the COVID-19 pandemic, Reece Limited implemented various measures to control the spread of the virus. These measures often included restrictions on certain activities to reduce person-to-person contact and minimize the risk of transmission.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: A self-audit in Reece Limited involves systematically and comprehensively examining an organization's health and safety practices, policies, and procedures. The goal is to assess compliance with regulations, identify areas for improvement, and ensure a safe and healthy work environment.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Monthly safety meetings are a crucial component of a comprehensive health and safety program at Reece Limited. These meetings provide an opportunity to communicate critical safety information, discuss relevant topics, and engage employees in maintaining a safe work environment.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Develop a comprehensive annual safety audit that outlines the scope, schedule, and methodology of the safety audit. Identify specific areas and processes that will be audited, including policies, procedures, training, hazard identification, emergency response, and incident reporting.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: A safety training program is essential for promoting an organization's safety culture. A program ensures that employees have the knowledge and skills to identify and mitigate workplace hazards, adhere to safety protocols, and contribute to a safer work environment.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: The inspection training program is crucial for ensuring that individuals responsible for inspections are well-equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills. Inspections are vital in identifying and mitigating workplace hazards, ensuring regulatory compliance, and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column8: Supporting Systems and Control from the safety department
column13: In a safety department, supporting systems and controls are essential to ensuring the effective implementation of safety measures, risk management, and compliance with regulations. These systems and controls contribute to creating a safe and healthy work environment.

Developing a cyber simulation training and education program is crucial for preparing individuals and organizations to respond effectively to cybersecurity threats.

column13: In the US, developing our team has been a top priority for the past five years since we acquired the business. Key initiatives we have designed, launched and rolled out in recent years include our IMPACT Graduate program, which fast-tracks college graduates through the Company.
